value: so I welcome you to the land and I would
just like to give you a brief history so
you have some grounding you're in
curwensville and i asked zach what was
this what you expected and he said no I
didn't realize that moves in the
mountains you know we are in a whole
different geological area than we are in
state college in that Valley Happy
Valley there are hills and vales all
through this place and right now we're
up on Mountain Road and it goes even
farther up to place called Greenwood and
the highest place on Interstate 80 this
side of the Mississippi so that's that's
where that's where you are so our
temperatures are always cooler I never
had air conditioning growing up you know
we never even thought about it because
we didn't need it here in the mountains
my husband and I met we both lived on
this very Road in alton road I lived at
the bottom he lived at the top we had
baby ducks when I was little we always
had ducks and rabbits at Easter and when
the Ducks got too big to run around the
house we brought him up to Morgan pond
which is where Terry you know was he was
raised in that big white house on the
road we dated in high school and i
shoveled cow manure with him and went
squirrel hunting and you know that's our
background together but I didn't want to
get married for a while because it was
the women's movement it was the 70s and
I said you know it's to get the heck out
of Dodge get out of her ones we'll go
see the world and leave this guy behind
and which I did for about 12 years and
then but then it was time for Shawn to
make his arrival in the world my son add
that we got married when I was 32 and
his parents had had a dairy farm a long
time ago 220 acres up here in this
little mountain they split up the
acreage and each of the seven siblings
got a parcel and we got 36 so you are on
seven acres of it here and across the
road and up on a hill is that another 22
Terry started building the cabin 28
years ago and it's still not done and
that cabin and this whole project has
been a bone of contention throughout our
whole marriage because we were living in
Chambersburg and Harrisburg and Terry to
drive off to Curwensville did went
around on this cabin and I was always
kind of halfway mad about it our
resources and his time was you know gone
and but it was his love and they
understood so as time went on it came to
me actually I have to I have to give
Michael Beckworth's credit for this I
don't let me know Michael Beckwith he is
one of the teachers in the personal
development movement today he's
african-american long dreadlocks
absolutely wonderful he's in the movie
the secret if you know that and anyway
he had something called life visioning
that he recommended people do which is a
way of just kind of tuning in to what
your purpose is and what you want and I
did that and when I did that it came to
me that this land could be part of my
dream not just Terry's and that's when
it came to me that I could do a retreat
center that was in 2006 and so we still
had to continue raising our children and
it wasn't time until three years ago in
three years ago we moved to state
college and the plan there was well we
could still work and have some resources
people that we might want to hook up
with for this project and that's and
that's why we're here today so now Terry
and I are developing the land in a
sustainable way permaculture we want to
implement all these practices that we
have to learn as we go so that's so
there's a lot of plans for garden and in
that kind of thing as well as personal
development programs so that that's why
I invited you because I see yoga here I
see Zach ism
former horticulture or a landscape
design student and so people got our
artists theatre regular our writers I
think yoga I feel therapists there
everyone has a place here it's just not
known yet what that place is so I wanted
to read to you our mission statement and
so that you get a sense of where we're
coming from our mission statement is to
study and support the ecology of the
land which is shared with humans
pursuing arts nature and sustainability
with possible outcomes of personal
transformation and spiritual growth and
development our statement of faith is
half moon hollow is a safe place for all
people who seek the way a peace
understanding and compassion in the
world people of all faiths all paths all
journeys are welcome
